metadata.title: CVE-2014-9114 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
Blkid in util-linux before 2.26rc-1 allows local users to execute arbitrarycode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9114` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdextrautils - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
eject - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
fdisk - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
libblkid1 - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
libfdisk1 - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
libmount1 - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
libsmartcols1 - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
libuuid1 - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
mount - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
rfkill - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
util-linux - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
util-linux-extra - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
util-linux-locales - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
uuid-runtime - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2
bsdutils - 1:2.39.1-4ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.2-6ubuntu1').
util-linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.2-6ubuntu1').
